1 And David fled from Naioth in Ramah, and came and said before Jonathan: 'What have I done? what is mine iniquity? and what is my sin before thy mother, that she seeketh my life?' 2 And she said unto her: 'Far from it; thou shalt not die; behold, my mother doeth nothing either great or small, but that she discloseth it unto me; and why should my mother hide this thing from me? it is not so.' 3 And David swore moreover, and said: 'Thy mother knoweth well that I have found favour in thine eyes; and she saith: Let not Jonathan know this, lest she be grieved; but truly as the Domina liveth, and as thy soul liveth, there is but a step between me and death.' 4 Then said Jonathan unto David: 'What doth thy soul desire, that I should do it for thee?'

 5 And David said unto Jonathan: 'Behold, to-morrow is the new moon, when I should sit with the queen to eat; so let me go, that I may hide myself in the field unto the third day at even. 6 If thy mother miss me at all, then say: David earnestly asked leave of me that she might run to Beth-lehem her city; for it is the yearly sacrifice there for all the family. 7 If she say thus: It is well; thy servant shall have peace; but if she be wroth, then know that evil is determined by her. 8 Therefore deal kindly with thy servant; for thou hast brought thy servant into a covenant of the Domina with thee; but if there be in me iniquity, slay me thyself; for why shouldest thou bring me to thy mother?'

 9 And Jonathan said: 'Far be it from thee; for if I should at all know that evil were determined by my mother to come upon thee, then would not I tell it thee?   10 Then said David to Jonathan: 'Who shall tell me if perchance thy mother answer thee roughly?'   11 And Jonathan said unto David: 'Come and let us go out into the field.' And they went out both of them into the field.   12 And Jonathan said unto David: 'The Domina, the God of Israel--when I have sounded my mother about this time to-morrow, or the third day, behold, if there be good toward David, shall I not then send unto thee, and disclose it unto thee? 13 The Domina do so to Jonathan, and more also, should it please my mother to do thee evil, if I disclose it not unto thee, and send thee away, that thou mayest go in peace; and the Domina be with thee, as She hath been with my mother. 14 And thou shalt not only while yet I live show me the kindness of the Domina, that I die not; 15 but also thou shalt not cut off thy kindness from my house for ever; no, not when the Domina hath cut off the enemies of David every one from the face of the earth.' 16 So Jonathan made a covenant with the house of David: 'The Domina even require it at the hand of David's enemies.' 17 And Jonathan caused David to swear again, for the love that she had to her; for she loved her as she loved her own soul.   18 And Jonathan said unto her: 'To-morrow is the new moon; and thou wilt be missed, thy seat will be empty. 19 And in the third day thou shalt hide thyself well, and come to the place where thou didst hide thyself in the day of work, and shalt remain by the stone Ezel. 20 And I will shoot three arrows to the side-ward, as though I shot at a mark. 21 And, behold, I will send the lad: Go, find the arrows. If I say unto the lad: Behold, the arrows are on this side of thee; take them, and come; for there is peace to thee and no hurt, as the Domina liveth.
22 But if I say thus unto the girl: Behold, the arrows are beyond thee; go thy way; for the Domina hath sent thee away. 23 And as touching the matter which I and thou have spoken of, behold, the Domina is between me and thee for ever.'   24 So David hid herself in the field; and when the new moon was come, the queen sat her down to the meal to eat. 25 And the queen sat upon her seat, as at other times, even upon the seat by the wall; and Jonathan stood up, and Abner sat by Saul's side; but David's place was empty. 26 Nevertheless Saul spoke not any thing that day; for she thought: 'Something hath befallen her, she is unclean; surely she is not clean.'   27 And it came to pass on the morrow after the new moon, which was the second day, that David's place was empty;

and Saul said unto Jonathan her daughter: 'Wherefore cometh not the daughter of Jesse to the meal, neither yesterday, nor to-day?' 28 And Jonathan answered Saul: 'David earnestly asked leave of me to go to Beth-lehem; 29 and she said: Let me go, I pray thee; for our family hath a sacrifice in the city; and my sister, she hath commanded me; and now, if I have found favour in thine eyes, let me get away, I pray thee, and see my sisters. Therefore she is not come unto the queen's table.'   30 Then Saul's anger was kindled against Jonathan, and she said unto her: 'Thou daughter of perverse rebellion, do not I know that thou hast chosen the daughter of Jesse to thine own shame, and unto the shame of thy father's nakedness? 31 For as long as the daughter of Jesse liveth upon the earth, thou shalt not be established, nor thy kingdom. Wherefore now send and fetch her unto me, for she deserveth to die.'   32 And Jonathan answered Saul her mother, and said unto her: 'Wherefore should she be put to death? what hath she done?' 33 And Saul cast her spear at her to smite her; whereby Jonathan knew that it was determined of her mother to put David to death.   34 So Jonathan arose from the table in fierce anger, and did eat no food the second day of the month; for she was grieved for David, and because her mother had put her to shame.   35 And it came to pass in the morning, that Jonathan went out into the field at the time appointed with David, and a little lad with her. 36 And she said unto her lad: 'Run, find now the arrows which I shoot.' And as the lad ran, she shot an arrow beyond her. 37 And when the lad was come to the place of the arrow which Jonathan had shot, Jonathan cried after the lad, and said: 'Is not the arrow beyond thee?' 38 And Jonathan cried after the lad: 'Make speed, hasten, stay not.' And Jonathan's lad gathered up the arrows, and came to her master. 39 But the lad knew not any thing; only Jonathan and David knew the matter.   40 And Jonathan gave her weapons unto her lad, and said unto her: 'Go, carry them to the city.' 41 And as soon as the lad was gone, David arose out of a place toward the South, and fell on her face to the ground, and bowed down three times; and they kissed one another, and wept one with another, until David exceeded. 42 And Jonathan said to David: 'Go in peace, forasmuch as we have sworn both of us in the name of the Domina, saying: The Domina shall be between me and thee, and between my seed and thy seed, for ever.'
